intro: Brayopsis calycina, commonly known as the calycine bryophyte, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its slender, creeping stems that often form dense mats on rocky or soil surfaces. The plant features leafy shoots with elongated, pointed leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on short, upright stalks and produce spores for dispersal. Brayopsis calycina is typically found in moist, shaded environments and is a common component of temperate forest floors.
